project.teaser: The ongoing decarbonisation of the energy and transport systems is a current challenge in Europe. As the rising prices of fossil natural gas make evident, the need to increase renewable gas capacity is undeniable and goes hand in hand with solving bottlenecks that current...
project.objective: The ongoing decarbonisation of the energy and transport systems is a current challenge in Europe. As the rising prices of fossil natural gas make evident, the need to increase renewable gas capacity is undeniable and goes hand in hand with solving bottlenecks that current biomethane production technologies cannot effectively address. The HYFUELUP project aims to demonstrate a flexible and hybrid pathway for the efficient and cost-effective production of biomethane through thermochemical technologies combined with renewable hydrogen. A complete deployment value chain, including biomethane offtake and distribution, will also be demonstrated to contribute to the market penetration of biomethane in key sectors. Thanks to the broad composition of the consortium, the project will blend market knowledge with advanced academic and industrial perspectives to demonstrate the production of biomethane at scale. First, the flexible conversion of low-grade feedstocks via sorption-enhanced gasification will be validated, coupled with syngas or flue gas clean-up, in a demonstrator at TRL6. Then, a second demonstrator will also validate fluidised-bed methanation of either syngas or flue gas with the dynamic addition of hydrogen at TRL6, before both technologies are integrated into a third demonstrator to produce biomethane at scale and reach TRL7. Together, such developments work toward reaching the impacts of the work programme and lead to relevant changes in action and practice via two well-defined impact pathways (“technological development and adoption”, and “enhancing capacity”) that will ultimately help strengthen the European scientific leadership for the development of a highly competitive renewable gas industry, widen the technology portfolio of biomethane production technologies, and improve citizen well-being via reduced climate and social risks.
project.title: HYBRID BIOMETHANE PRODUCTION FROM INTEGRATED BIOMASS CONVERSION
project.keywords: Biomethane, SEG, Oxy-SEG, Digestate, low-value feedstock, FB methanation

article.title: Innovative biomethane for REPowerEU
article.teaser: Europe’s energy security is under pressure from rising costs, climate change, domestic and international energy policy, and conflict. Biomethane – natural gas produced from renewable sources such as municipal and agricultural waste – offers a reliable, drop-in fuel that can meet the energy needs of citizens. This Projects Info Pack showcases the research being carried out to grow Europe’s biomethane industry, boosting energy security and helping to deliver on the EU’s ambitions for a competitive, low-carbon economy.

webItem.title: Filling the tank
webItem.alternativeText: An illustration of the contributions made by each source to the overall goal of 35 billion cubic metres of biomethane production, rendered as liquid levels in a large cylindrical gas tower.

webItem.title: Fuelling innovation
webItem.alternativeText: An illustration showing how the various elements support biomethane production. Artificial photosynthesis supplies the gas network directly. Wood biomass is gasified and sent to the gas network. Waste waters and organic matter feed the anaerobic digester, which produces biogas that is refined to biomethane before being injected into the gas network. Waste from the city, including CO2, is returned to the anaerobic digester.

webItem.title: Investing in a greener future
webItem.alternativeText: An illustration showing the value of projects in millions of euro, arranged by funding stream. Coordination and Support Actions include Bin2Grid (0.71), BiogasAction (2.0), BIOSURF (1.87), DiBiCoo (3), ISAAC (1.48), ISABEL (1.9) and REGATRACE (3). Research and Innovation Actions include CarbonNeutralLNG (3.31), CRONUS (4.39), DESIRED (3.06), FlexSNG (4.23), NET-Fuels (4.50) and PRODIGIO (2.45). Innovation Actions include BIOMETHAVERSE (9.87), HYFUELUP (10.29), METHAREN (10.36) and SEMPRE-BIO (11.75).

article.title: Innovative biomethane to support Europe’s energy independence
article.teaser: A new Projects Info Pack from CORDIS highlights the ongoing research helping to deliver REPowerEU’s goal of ending reliance on Russian gas imports by 2030 and accelerating Europe’s transition to a clean energy system.

article.title: Greening transport through locally sourced plant waste
article.teaser: Adapting gasification technology to utilise a wide range of woody wastes could lower the cost of biomethane, helping Europe to decarbonise the energy and transport sectors and cut reliance on fossil fuel imports.

result.title: Quality and risk management plan
result.description: This deliverable will comprise the quality plan for the HYFUELUP project and the risk planning and monitoring procedures to be used by the consortium. The document will outline rules, mechanisms and processes established to maintain a high-quality level in project implementation and corresponding results. It will also detail procedures to identify and monitor risks, describing the actions that are needed to prepare and implement a proper contingency plan. Both the list of risks and the contingency plan will be regularly reviewed and updated during the execution of the project, on topics where it will be required and according to the results that will be achieved.

result.title: Lignocellulosic potential assessment and feedstock characterisation
result.description: An assessment of type, availability, costs, harvesting and logistic strategies for the various lignocellulosic feedstocks will be provided in this deliverable, as well as set of relevant information about the composition and properties of the different feedstocks selected for the project.

result.title: Joint policy recommendations. Cluster of Horizon Europe-funded projects on innovative biomethane production.
result.description: Joint deliverable, in collaboration with projects funded under topic HORIZON-CL5-2021-D3-03-16 (101084297 SEMPRE-BIO, 101084200 BIOMETHAVERSE, 101084288 METHAREN), including guidelines and recommendations to policy makers. Updated in M24 and M42. Project SEMPRE-BIO will be in charge of coordinating the first delivery (M12), HYFUELUP (BIOPLAT) of the second (M24) and BIOMETHAVERSE of the final (M42).

result.title: 1st publishable report on the evolution, advances, and results
result.description: Drafting and publication of the first report to show the progress and partial outcomes.

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: This plan will be the project management’s main document, ensuring collaboration between the partners. It will establish clear guidelines for the project’s development, providing direction regarding specific conducts, planning, efforts, internal communication, reporting procedures and adjustments.

result.title: Introductory/ Conceptual video
result.description: Developing and sharing a promotional animated video to communicate HFU’s objectives, potential, outcomes and benefits for society in a dynamic and easy to understand way.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - HYFUELUP (HYBRID BIOMETHANE PRODUCTION FROM INTEGRATED BIOMASS CONVERSION)
result.teaser: Biomethane is one of the most promising renewable fuels for the decarbonisation of energy and transport systems. As the European Union aims to achieve climate neutrality by 2050, the demand for scaling up renewable gas capacity, particularly biomethane, is becoming...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
